moves.1. e4: This is just a regular, innocent game.
moves.2. Nf3: Knight moved to f3 to attack Black's e-pawn.
moves.2... Nc6: Black's knight moved out to protect.
moves.3. Bc4: This move was made to attack the weakest link; the f-pawn.
moves.3... d6: Black moves d6 so he can bring out his bishop to pin the knight on f3.
moves.4... Bg4: As expected. White's knight is now pinned.
moves.5. Nxe5: Nxe5 is a very risky move. It leaves the queen exposed for attack but Legal knew his opponent couldn't resist the urge to capture White's queen.
moves.5... Bxd1: Black falls for the trap. White is now easily prepared to unleash a devastating attack. A better move would be Nxe5, then Qxg4 for some compensation followed by Nxc4 and black would be winning.
moves.6... Ke7: This is the only legal move for black.
moves.7. Nd5#: This is called the legal mate. It is a trap that involves the sacrifice of the queen. This is the game that engraved Legal's name in chess history.
